newsitem.title: FRANCE: Euro body rejects Scientology case against Germany.
newsitem.headline: Euro body rejects Scientology case against Germany.

text.p: The European Commission of Human Rights threw out a discrimination case on Wednesday brought by the Church of Scientology against Germany on grounds the sect had not exhausted domestic legal channels.

After reviewing the charges, the Commission decided not to pass on the case to the European Court of Human Rights, which may rule only after legal means within the country concerned have been thoroughly explored.
Scientology, which counts some 30,000 followers in Germany, complained that the German government considered it a commercial enterprise, rather than a religion.
It also charged that several German Lander have taken measures to reduce its influence, banning Scientology members from certain jobs and telling the population the sect is "dangerous".
